channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: One Boston Bombing Suspect Dead, Another Remains At Large
item.description: One suspect in Monday’s Boston Marathon bombings has been apprehended, according to an official with knowledge of the investigation. Another appears to remain on the loose in Watertown after a firefight with police.

item.title: What We Know About Boston Marathon Bomb Suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev
item.description: Although the AP and NBC report that Dzhokhar Tsarnaev came to the U.S. from or near Chechnya, he has several apparent years of history in Massachusetts.

item.title: Boston Is A De Facto Police State Right Now
item.description: In an unprecedented move, the city of Boston, in its entirety, is being asked to shelter-in-place, with schools and mass transit closed.

item.title: Updates On The Hunt For The Boston Marathon Bombers
item.description: Early Friday morning, one of the two suspects was killed in a violent standoff with the police in Watertown, Mass. Another suspect is still at large and the police are conducting a massive manhunt.

item.title: A Video Recap Of Last Night's Events In Boston
item.description: 1 suspect dead, 1 wanted, 2 officers down in flurry of bullets and bombs.

item.title: The Cryptic Return Of A Programming Legend Who Committed 'Infosuicide'
item.description: He was an influential figure in the Ruby programming community, where he was perhaps best known for his educational works, and especially his efforts to teach kids how to code. No one knows why he disappeared. He left no goodbyes.

item.title: Why Do We Cry?
item.description: Why does your face leak when you're sad or emotional?

item.title: Police Officer Shot To Death On MIT Campus
item.description: A Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus police officer was shot to death on Thursday night, authorities say.

item.title: How Rabies Spawned Vampires And Zombies
item.description: “What disturbs me is I smashed his mouth off, I smashed his teeth in, but he still wanted to continue in the attack mode. I was terrified at [its] resilience.”

item.title: Reddit, Boston And The Missing Student
item.description: The reason why we leave crime-solving to the professionals is that they are the professionals.

item.title: Absent From Boston Bomb Investigation And Relief: U.S. Military
item.description: Assuming the Boston Marathon bombs were jury-rigged together, the Marathon attack represents the first major domestic homemade bomb attack of the post-9/11 era. But first responders and federal law enforcement didn’t call on any significant Defense Department aid.

item.title: Detroit Police Picking Up Homeless And Dumping Them Outside Of City
item.description: In a complaint filed with the U.S. Justice Department, the Michigan ACLU says that Detroit police have been picking up homeless people from the popular Greektown neighborhood and dropping them off miles away, sometimes even outside of city limits.

item.title: Crashing The Annual Taco Bell Congressional Reception
item.description: It's basically an all-you-can-eat Taco Bell buffet with free beer and wine. Never are so many free chalupas and beers together with so few stoned people.

item.title: Amateur Video Footage Of Boston Shootout
item.description: A resident of Watertown thought to take some video of the shootout with the Boston Marathon attack suspects last night.

item.title: A Map Of The Police Showdown With The Marathon Bombing Suspects
item.description: A crowdsourced map of Thursday night's and Friday morning's events in the Boston-area.

item.title: In The Land Of The Coffee Nerds
item.description: “This is what coffee tasted like in nineteenth century!” Peter Giuliano exclaimed, holding a cup of Bard coffee’s Sumatra Wahana Natural as we talked at the Specialty Coffee Association of America's twenty-fifth annual exposition. “I’ve never tasted anything like it.”

item.title: In Move To Pwn Boys, Girl Scouts Introduce Game Developer Badge
item.description: On the heels of the Boy Scouts introducing a merit badge for game design, the Girl Scouts are going one better by developing a badge program to bring girls into the world of video game development.

item.title: New, Higher-Resolution Image Of Boston Marathon Suspect Emerges
item.description: On Thursday, when the Federal Bureau of Investigation released images of the two suspects in the blast, David Green’s friends began to notice a figure in a white hat in the bottom left corner of his picture that closely resembled one of the suspects.

item.title: Boston Bombing Victim In Iconic Photo Helped Identify Attackers
item.description: Minutes before the bombs blew up in Boston, Jeff Bauman looked into the eyes of the man who tried to kill him.

item.title: Harrison Ford Cursed Out Chewbacca
item.description: Chewbacca wanted to apologize for sleeping with Han Solo's wife, but Harrison Ford was in no mood to forgive.

item.title: This Is The Most Important Spy You've Never Heard Of
item.description: Hard time in the toughest ward of a Texas prison hasn’t softened the former Defense Department wunderkind. Years after Ana Montes was caught spying for Cuba, she remains defiant.

item.title: This Grad Student Just Shook The Global Austerity Movement
item.description: Thomas Herndon, a 28-year-old economics grad student at UMass Amherst, just used part of his spring semester to shake the intellectual foundation of the global austerity movement.

item.title: Man Seeks Your Money To Build A Twister-Proof Van
item.description: Part of a Kickstarter project, this Ford commercial van looks more like a tank, but can it stand up to 200 mph winds?

item.title: Do You Know These Men?
item.description: The FBI on Thursday released surveillance video showing two potential suspects in the Boston Marathon bombing.

item.title: You Think You Can Jump Rope? You Can't
item.description: Adrienn Banhegyi is a performer with Cirque de Soleil and holds two world records for jump roping. And this is why.

item.title: Behold The Most Hilarious Abandoned Websites
item.description: For every new website that goes up, there are some like these that get lost or forgotten – along with a sense of what online culture used to look like.

item.title: The Best Career Advice You'll Never Hear In A Graduation Speech
item.description: “Follow your passion” is the stupidest career advice I’ve ever heard. Why? Because my passion in life is for singing bad karaoke. Instead, here's some actually valuable career advice.

item.title: The Ten Largest Ships Ever Conceived
item.description: It's actually pretty hard to determine the largest ship in the world. Because apparently "ship" is a contentious term.
